name: Potato
long_desc: Potatoes are underground tubers that grow on the roots of the potato plant. They are a staple food in many cultures and can be prepared in numerous ways, including boiling, baking, frying, and mashing.

name: Tomato
short_desc: Juicy and flavorful fruit (commonly used as a vegetable)
long_desc: Tomatoes are botanically classified as fruits but are commonly used as vegetables in cooking. They are known for their juicy texture and sweet-tart flavor. Tomatoes are used in salads, sauces, soups, and various other dishes.

name: Carrot
long_desc: Carrots are root vegetables that are known for their bright orange color and sweet, crunchy texture. They are rich in beta-carotene, which is converted into vitamin A in the body. Carrots can be eaten raw, cooked, or juiced.

name: Broccoli
long_desc: Broccoli is a nutritious green vegetable that belongs to the cruciferous vegetable family. It is rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. Broccoli can be steamed, boiled, stir-fried, or eaten raw.

name: Spinach
short_desc: Leafy green vegetable packed with nutrients
long_desc: Spinach is a leafy green vegetable that is loaded with nutrients such as vitamins A, C, and K, as well as iron, calcium, and folate. It has a mild, slightly sweet flavor and can be eaten raw in salads or cooked in various dishes.

name: Cucumber
long_desc: Cucumbers are long, cylindrical vegetables with a refreshing and hydrating taste. They are composed mainly of water and are low in calories. Cucumbers can be sliced and eaten raw, added to salads, or used to make pickles.
